result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • James R Vanmeter was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • James R Vanmeter was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for James R Vanmeter
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2016)
Prior: W1613 Golf View Dr, Montello, WI 53949
for Ignition Interlock Exemptions amd Removing Title Transfer Stops

8:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to OWI - 3rd offense and possession of THC, and counts 2 & 4 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Johnson concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1-OWI-3rd offense as charged and count 3 - Possess THC as charged.  Court orders counts 2 be dismissed and count 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1 (OWI-3rd)

-50 days county jail with huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-$650.00 Fine and costs totalling $1,807.00 - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 27 months
-IID - 27 months
-AODA & any follow-up (Marquette Co)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Count 3 (Possess THC)

-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Jail.

Court adjourned at 8:55 a.m.

After court - Court orders 2015TR1404 be dismissed.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 08:45 am

2:41 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - defendant is laid off and requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for plea and sentencing on March 7, 2016 at 8:45 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:42 p.m.
State's
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing at 01-05-2016 02:30 pm
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

9:15 a.m. No appearance by the Defendant.  Atty Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johnson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Johnson enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Ten days to sign and file the bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 5, 2016 at 2:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:17 a.m.
